properties.areaDesc: Mono; Western Nevada Basin and Range including Pyramid Lake; Mineral and Southern Lyon Counties; Greater Reno-Carson City-Minden Area; Greater Lake Tahoe Area; Northern Washoe County; Lassen-Eastern Plumas-Eastern Sierra Counties; Surprise Valley California; Greater Lake Tahoe Area
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 9 at 2:30PM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* The next in a series of winter storms will affect the region
Friday overnight into Saturday. Light snow showers with travel
impacts are expected over the Sierra and northeast California,
however the main story will likely be wind. Strong gusty
southwest winds will probably bring travel impacts to wind prone
areas such as Washoe Valley and along Highway 395 in Mono
County. Rough air can also be expected for flying.

* A few snow showers are possible Sunday into Monday with the best
chance of travel impacts over the northern Sierra passes and
northeast California. The next significant storm hits the region
Monday night into Tuesday. This storm has potential for both
widespread strong gusty winds especially in far western Nevada
and heavy mountain snowfall. Snow accumulation is possible in
western Nevada but less certain as usual.

* Wednesday night into Thursday next week continues to showcase
the strongest storm of the sequence. Current indications show
widespread heavy snowfall for both mountains and western Nevada
valleys, along with high wind potential for most areas. This
scenario would be quite disruptive for travel in the region,
but since we're still 6-7 days out things of course can change.

* Anyone with road or air travel plans over the coming week should
keep a close eye on the forecast. Disruptions and delays are
possible from these storms. For road condition information check
with NDOT or Caltrans or your favorite mapping app.

NWSheadline: Series of Winter Storms into Next Week
